intro: Euploca sessei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf euploca, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that are typically arranged in umbels, and its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating. Euploca sessei is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat, with features that help it conserve water and survive in harsh environments.
